alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 28 at 12:31PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RIVER LEVELS TO REMAIN HIGH THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND... River levels in the Cascades, eastern Oregon mountains and the Blue Mountain Foothills are peaking this afternoon and will be dropping for the next day or two then remain steady through Wednesday night. More rain and mountain snow is expected Thursday through next weekend, which will lead to another round of river rises. At this time, no rivers are forecast to reach flood stage through next weekend. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated if conditions or river forecasts change.
